questions.question: Can you describe your experience with Power BI?
questions.answer: S: Over the past 6 years, I’ve worked in various sectors using Power BI, including healthcare, insurance, retail, and IT. T: My role was to build interactive and scalable dashboards to support decision-making. A: I developed over 50 dashboards using Power BI Desktop and Service, integrated data using Power Query, and modeled it using DAX and RLS. R: These solutions provided end users with actionable insights, improved data access control, and significantly reduced manual reporting.

questions.question: How do you ensure data accuracy in your reports?
questions.answer: S: In multiple reporting environments, maintaining data accuracy was critical to ensure stakeholder trust. T: I needed to implement reliable mechanisms for validating KPIs and preventing errors. A: I added validation rules during transformations, tested DAX measures with sample data, and used visual alerts for anomalies. I also coordinated stakeholder reviews and set up refresh audits. R: This approach minimized reporting errors and built credibility in the reports I delivered.

questions.question: What’s your approach to data modeling in Power BI?
questions.answer: S: In complex projects, poor data models often led to performance issues and user confusion. T: My task was to build scalable, performant data models that supported future enhancements. A: I applied star schema principles, created calculated tables, and optimized relationships. I also reduced row-level calculations by using summary tables. R: This improved report load times and allowed the business to scale their reporting needs efficiently.

questions.question: Explain Row-Level Security (RLS) and how you’ve used it.
questions.answer: S: At Northside Hospital, clinical dashboards needed to restrict data access to department-level views. T: I had to implement secure data access based on user roles. A: I defined roles in Power BI, used RLS filters, and tested using the 'View As Role' feature before publishing. R: This ensured compliance with data privacy policies and improved stakeholder confidence in data access.

questions.question: How do you handle performance issues in Power BI reports?
questions.answer: S: I encountered performance issues in reports with large datasets and slow visuals. T: I was responsible for diagnosing and optimizing these reports. A: I used DAX Studio and Performance Analyzer, replaced heavy measures with columns where possible, removed unused fields, and avoided bi-directional filters. R: These actions significantly improved report speed and responsiveness.

questions.question: Have you worked with Power BI Gateways and Dataflows?
questions.answer: S: At Manhattan Associates, multiple reports needed shared ETL logic and scheduled data refresh from on-prem sources. T: I was tasked with configuring gateways and standardizing data ingestion. A: I set up Power BI Gateway for SQL Server connections and developed shared Dataflows to centralize transformations. R: This streamlined data management, reduced refresh failures, and improved cross-report consistency.

questions.question: How do you manage version control with PBIX files?
questions.answer: S: Our team faced challenges managing PBIX versions and ensuring documentation consistency. T: I needed to implement a reliable version control process for Power BI assets. A: I used Git for scripts and documentation, enforced naming conventions for PBIX files, and leveraged deployment pipelines for separating datasets and reports. R: This improved auditability and reduced confusion during updates and releases.

questions.question: Describe a dashboard you’re proud of.
questions.answer: S: At Hiscox Insurance, the fraud detection team lacked visibility into potential claim anomalies. T: I was asked to build a dashboard that could surface risk indicators across data sources. A: I combined internal claims data with external trend indicators, applied AI visuals and drill-through filters, and used conditional formatting. R: The dashboard reduced review time by 60% and uncovered $750K in premium mismatches.

questions.question: How do you stay updated with Power BI features?
questions.answer: S: Staying current with Power BI’s rapid updates is essential in my role. T: I aimed to keep my knowledge fresh and share it with my team. A: I follow Power BI blogs, Guy in a Cube, and SQLBI. I test new features in monthly updates and run internal demo sessions. R: This has helped my teams adopt new capabilities faster and improve report design practices.

questions.question: What do you think makes a great Power BI dashboard?
questions.answer: S: I've seen many dashboards that look nice but don’t help users make decisions. T: I focus on building dashboards that are both functional and elegant. A: I prioritize clarity, ensure that the top KPIs are visible in under 5 seconds, and maintain consistent layout and navigation. R: This approach increases adoption and ensures users can act on insights without needing training.
